page.title: 06Schooling in the area.
page.content: Education in the area is the responsibility of Merton and Sutton Local Education Authorities. Merton has Primary(5-9),Middle(9-13)and High (13-18)Schools, while in Sutton pupils change schools at the age of 11. The Merton Schools include St.Teresa's Primary,Malmesbury Middle, St.Catherine's Middle, Garth High and Willows High School all of which are part of a Comprehensive system.Several of the schools were built in the 1930's to co-incide with the development of the St. Helier Estate. St.Teresa's and St.Catherine's are two of the Catholic schools in Merton. Sutton schools include Cheam Park Farm and Tweeddale Primaries, Gaynesford High and the only Comprehensive school in Sutton, Greenshaw High.Gaynesford will close, because of falling rolls in August 1985.
